author: langers
content:
Hey everyone, here are some perspectives from Rocket Pool.

**Will the Rocket Pool protocol use MaxEB to consolidate validators?**
- Each validator in Rocket Pool has its own withdrawal credential smart contract
- We would not be able to consolidate our validators using the consolidation feature
- We will use 0x02 validators in our next release
- But for our current node operators to take advantage, they will have to exit and reenter
- Rocket Pool has a median node to validator count of 2 so we wouldn't make much difference anyway
- There will be an incentive for large operators to migrate and consolidate but we would expect them to do it gradually

**Would the Rocket Pool protocol use the partial withdrawal feature?**
- It is unlikely the Rocket Pool protocol would use the partial withdrawal feature directly
- We leave it up to node operators to decide when and how to withdraw funds
- The protocol currently redeposits rewards for compounding - MaxEB makes this much more efficient

**How often will Rocket Pool node operators use the partial withdrawal feature?**
- This is hard to tell - I am trying to calculate a proxy metric from how often they withdraw now
- But the game changes with auto-compounding 
- It is likely that some node operators withdraw rewards for tax but many operators would prefer the compounding effect
- I hope to get some empirical data but failing that we can run a poll on our forum
- From a MaxEB perspective, Rocket Pool == a bunch of solo stakers

I am in contact with a few staking pools. If it is helpful I can create a group (probs Telegram) to aid the conversation.
